<li id="cite_note-385"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-385">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFDelfin2013">Delfin, Fredercik (June 12, 2013). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3895641" rel="nofollow">"Complete mtDNA genomes of Filipino ethnolinguistic groups: a melting pot of recent and ancient lineages in the Asia-Pacific regio"</a>. <i>European Journal of Human Genetics</i>. <b>22</b> (2): 228–237. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1038%2Fejhg.2013.122" rel="nofollow">10.1038/ejhg.2013.122</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a> <span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3895641" rel="nofollow">3895641</a></span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a> <a class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23756438" rel="nofollow">23756438</a>. <q>Indian influence and possibly haplogroups M52'58 and M52a were brought to the Philippines as early as the fifth century AD. However, Indian influence through these trade empires were indirect and mainly commercial; moreover, other Southeast Asian groups served as filters that diluted or enriched any Indian influence that reached the Philippines</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=European+Journal+of+Human+Genetics&amp;rft.atitle=Complete+mtDNA+genomes+of+Filipino+ethnolinguistic+groups%3A+a+melting+pot+of+recent+and+ancient+lineages+in+the+Asia-Pacific+regio&amp;rft.volume=22&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=228-237&amp;rft.date=2013-06-12&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3895641%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F23756438&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1038%2Fejhg.2013.122&amp;rft.aulast=Delfin&amp;rft.aufirst=Fredercik&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC3895641&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-386"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-386">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://repository.arizona.edu/bitstream/handle/10150/333213/azu_etd_13473_sip1_m.pdf?sequence=1&amp;isAllowed=y&amp;title=repository.arizona.edu" rel="nofollow">Peasants, Servants, and Sojourners: Itinerant Asians in Colonial New Spain, 1571-1720 By Furlong, Matthew J.</a> "Slaves purchased by the indigenous elites, Spanish and Hokkiens of the colony seemed drawn most often from South Asia, particularly Bengal and South India, and less so, from other sources, such as East Africa, Brunei, Makassar, and Java..." Chapter 2 "Rural Ethnic Diversity" Page 164 (Translated from: "Inmaculada Alva Rodríguez, Vida municipal en Manila (siglos xvi-xvii) (Córdoba: Universidad de Córdoba, 1997), 31, 35-36."</span>

<li id="cite_note-387"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-387">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFRawashdeh2016">Rawashdeh, Saeb (October 11, 2016). <a class="external text" href="http://www.jordantimes.com/news/local/arab-world%E2%80%99s-ancient-links-philippines-forged-through-trade-migration-and-islam-%E2%80%94" rel="nofollow">"Arab world's ancient links to Philippines forged through trade, migration and Islam — ambassador"</a>. <i>The Jordan Times</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">September 11,</span> 2020</span>. <q>In the case of the Philippines, the ancient Hadrami migration found its way from Islamised areas in the south towards Sulu, the southwestern archipelagic region of the Philippines," she said, adding that the Hadramis settled in Cotabato, Maguindao, Zamboanga, Davao and Bukidnon. An estimated 2 per cent of Filipinos can claim Arab ancestry, the ambassador noted.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Jordan+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Arab+world%27s+ancient+links+to+Philippines+forged+through+trade%2C+migration+and+Islam+%E2%80%94+ambassador&amp;rft.date=2016-10-11&amp;rft.aulast=Rawashdeh&amp;rft.aufirst=Saeb&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.jordantimes.com%2Fnews%2Flocal%2Farab-world%25E2%2580%2599s-ancient-links-philippines-forged-through-trade-migration-and-islam-%25E2%2580%2594&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-395"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-395">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTakacs2015">Takacs, Sarolta (2015). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=u1TrBgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA659" rel="nofollow"><i>The Modern World: Civilizations of Africa, Civilizations of Europe, Civilizations of the Americas, Civilizations of the Middle East and Southwest Asia, Civilizations of Asia and the Pacific</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-430"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-430">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200722002112/https://psa.gov.ph/vital-statistics/id/138794" rel="nofollow">"Registered Deaths in the Philippines, 2017"</a>. <i>Philippine Statistics Authority</i>. <li id="cite_note-446"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-446">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20201123192611/https://www.manilastandard.net/spotlight/corporate-philanthropy-csr-champions-of-today/287371/develop-your-skills-with-tesda.html" rel="nofollow">"Develop your skills with TESDA"</a>. <i>Manila Standard</i>. <li id="cite_note-madrasa-448"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-madrasa_448-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFJerry_E._Esplanada2009">Jerry E. <li id="cite_note-482"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-482">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140327100210/http://www.bsp.gov.ph/downloads/Publications/2012/ICT_2010.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Results of the 2010 Survey of Information Technology-Business Process Outsourcing (IT-BPO) Services"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas</i>. <li id="cite_note-505"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-505">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDepartment_of_TransportationDepartment_of_the_Interior_and_Local_GovernmentLand_Transportation_Franchising_and_Regulatory_Board2017"><a href="/wiki/Department_of_Transportation_(Philippines)" title="Department of Transportation (Philippines)">Department of Transportation</a>; <a href="/wiki/Department_of_the_Interior_and_Local_Government" title="Department of the Interior and Local Government">Department of the Interior and Local Government</a>; <a href="/wiki/Land_Transportation_Franchising_and_Regulatory_Board" title="Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board">Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board</a> (October 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200801043749/https://www.dilg.gov.ph/PDF_File/reports_resources/dilg-reports-resources-2017112_2cf0f97098.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Local Public Transport Route Plan Manual; Volume 1</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. pp. 7, 16. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">August 1,</span> 2020</span>. <q>Public Utility Vehicles (PUVs) – Vehicles that carry passengers and/or cargo for a fee, offering services to the public, which may include, but are not limited to, UV Express service, PUBs, PUJs, TNVS, Filcab and Taxis.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Local+Public+Transport+Route+Plan+Manual%3B+Volume+1&amp;rft.pages=7%2C+16&amp;rft.date=2017-10&amp;rft.au=Department+of+Transportation&amp;rft.au=Department+of+the+Interior+and+Local+Government&amp;rft.au=Land+Transportation+Franchising+and+Regulatory+Board&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dilg.gov.ph%2FPDF_File%2Freports_resources%2Fdilg-reports-resources-2017112_2cf0f97098.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-532"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-532">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200801035953/https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/publication/30420/regional-and-subregional-program-links.pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>Regional and subregional program links: mapping the links between ASEAN and the GMS, BIMP-EAGA, and IMT-GT</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-547"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-547">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFCinco2018">Cinco, Maricar (March 26, 2018). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180326035724/https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/978072/moriones-festival-returns-to-religious-roots" rel="nofollow">"Moriones: solemn tradition, not festive occasion"</a>. <i>Philippine Daily Inquirer</i>. <li id="cite_note-548"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-548">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200903161024/https://www.sunstar.com.ph/article/421022/Business/Sinulog-named-as-Asias-most-popular-festival" rel="nofollow">"Sinulog named as Asia's most popular festival"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/SunStar" title="SunStar">SunStar</a></i>. February 27, 2018. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://www.sunstar.com.ph/article/421022/Business/Sinulog-named-as-Asias-most-popular-festival" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on September 3, 2020<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-628"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-628">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDundes1994">Dundes, Alan (1994). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Wy5VqKSYt8IC" rel="nofollow"><i>The Cockfight: A Casebook</i></a>. </li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Government">Government</span></h3>
<ul><li><a class="external text" href="https://www.gov.ph/" rel="nofollow">Official website of the National Government of the Republic of the Philippines</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/" rel="nofollow">Official Gazette of the Republic of the Philippines</a></li>
<li><a class="external text" href="https://www.senate.gov.ph/" rel="nofollow">Official website of the Senate of the Philippines</a></li>

<ul><li><a class="external text" href="http://www.gutenberg.org/browse/authors/b#a2296" rel="nofollow">History of the Philippine Islands</a> in many volumes, from <a href="/wiki/Project_Gutenberg" title="Project Gutenberg">Project Gutenberg</a> (indexed under <a href="/wiki/Emma_Helen_Blair" title="Emma Helen Blair">Emma Helen Blair</a>, the general editor)</li>

Australian Broadcasting Corporation.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=ABC+News&amp;rft.atitle=The+Philippines+is+fronting+up+to+its+Spanish+heritage%2C+and+for+some+it%27s+paying+off&amp;rft.date=2019-08-10&amp;rft.aulast=Weedon&amp;rft.aufirst=Alan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.abc.net.au%2Fnews%2F2019-08-10%2Finside-the-push-to-bring-back-spanish-into-the-philippines%2F11356590&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APhilippines"></span> About the influence of the Spanish people and language</li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><div style="display: inline-block; line-height: 1.2em; padding: .1em 0;"><a href="/wiki/Dependent_territory" title="Dependent territory">Dependent<br/>territories</a></div></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"></div><table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Australia</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Christmas_Island" title="Christmas Island">Christmas Island</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Cocos_(Keeling)_Islands" title="Cocos (Keeling) Islands">Cocos (Keeling) Islands</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">United Kingdom</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Akrotiri_and_Dhekelia" title="Akrotiri and Dhekelia">Akrotiri and Dhekelia</a><sup>2</sup> (Sovereign Base Areas)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/British_Indian_Ocean_Territory" title="British Indian Ocean Territory">British Indian Ocean Territory</a> (<a href="/wiki/British_Overseas_Territories" title="British Overseas Territories">British Overseas Territory</a>)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><div style="display: inline-block; line-height: 1.2em; padding: .1em 0;"><a href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of China">Special administrative<br/>regions of China</a></div></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Hong_Kong" title="Hong Kong">Hong Kong</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Macau" title="Macau">Macau</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="3"><div><div class="hlist hlist-separated"><ul><li><sup>1</sup> Spans the conventional boundary between Europe and another continent.</li><li><sup>2</sup> Considered European for cultural, political and historical reasons but is geographically in Western Asia.</li></ul></div>
<ul><li><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="185" data-file-width="180" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/16px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/23px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/96/Symbol_category_class.svg/31px-Symbol_category_class.svg.png 2x" title="Category" width="16"/> <b><a href="/wiki/Category:Asia" title="Category:Asia">Category</a></b></li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="East_Asia_Summit_(EAS)" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:East_Asia_Summit_(EAS)" title="Template:East Asia Summit (EAS)"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:East_Asia_Summit_(EAS)" title="Template talk:East Asia Summit (EAS)"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:East_Asia_Summit_(EAS)&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="East_Asia_Summit_(EAS)" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/East_Asia_Summit" title="East Asia Summit">East Asia Summit</a> (EAS)</div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow hlist" colspan="2" style="font-weight: bold;"><div id="*_1st_*_2nd_*_3rd_*_4th_*_5th_*_6th_*_7th_*_8th_*_9th_*_10th_*_11th_*_12th_*_13th_*_14th_*_15th_*_16th">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/First_East_Asia_Summit" title="First East Asia Summit">1st</a></li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="World_Trade_Organization" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:World_Trade_Organization" title="Template:World Trade Organization"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:World_Trade_Organization" title="Template talk:World Trade Organization"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:World_Trade_Organization&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="World_Trade_Organization" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/World_Trade_Organization" title="World Trade Organization">World Trade Organization</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">System</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_World_Trade_Organization" title="Member states of the World Trade Organization">Accession and membership</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Appellate_Body" title="Appellate Body">Appellate Body</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Dispute_Settlement_Body" title="Dispute Settlement Body">Dispute Settlement Body</a></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Issues</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<li><a href="/wiki/Peace_Clause" title="Peace Clause">Peace Clause</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Agreements</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/General_Agreement_on_Tariffs_and_Trade" title="General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade">General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Agreement_on_Agriculture" title="Agreement on Agriculture">Agriculture</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Bali_Package" title="Bali Package">Bali Package</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Ministerial_Conference" title="Ministerial Conference">Ministerial<br/>Conferences</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div>
<ol><li><a href="/wiki/Special_administrative_regions_of_China" title="Special administrative regions of China">Special administrative regions of the People's Republic of China</a>, participating as "Hong Kong, China" and "Macao, China".</li>
<li>Officially the Republic of China, participates as "<a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu</a>", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.</li></ol>
<p><b><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="3002" data-file-width="3000" decoding="async" height="16" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg/16px-The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg/24px-The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg/32px-The_Earth_seen_from_Apollo_17.jpg 2x" width="16"/></a> <a href="/wiki/Portal:World" title="Portal:World">World portal</a></b>
</p>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
